results.title: Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon
results.creator_credit: Ang Lee, Bill Kong, Ligong Xu, Asian Union Film and Entertainment, China Films Co-Production, Columbia Pictures, EDKO Film, Good Machine International, Sony Pictures and Zoom Hunt International
results.brief_description: An epic love story and action drama set in China during the Qing dynasty, revolving around two sets of lovers. Li Mu Bai and Yu Shu Lien are duty bound warriors whose unspoken love spans decades. By comparison, their young romantic counterparts Jen Yu and Lo represent freedom, youth and unrestrained love.

constellations_other.name: Jason Phu and genre-bending kung fu films
constellations_other.description: Analects of Kung Phu work is a philosophical guide to life via martial arts films, drawing on his interest in Vietnamese and Chinese folklore, which inspires many of the films featured in this Constellation.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Ang Lee, Bill Kong, Ligong Xu, Asian Union Film and Entertainment, China Films Co-Production, Columbia Pictures, EDKO Film, Good Machine International, Sony Pictures and Zoom Hunt International
results.description: An epic love story and action drama, set in China during the Qing dynasty, revolving around two sets of lovers. Li Mu Bai (Chow Yun Fat) and Yu Shu Lien (Michelle Yeoh) are cast as duty bound warriors whose unspoken love for each other spans decades. By comparison, their young romantic counterparts Jen Yu (a promising young warrior) and Lo (her bandit lover) represent freedom, youth and unrestrained love. After Li surrenders his legendary sword to Yu and vows to stop fighting, his plans to retire are halted when the sword is stolen. In their quest to recover it, Li and Yu confront the evil forces headed by Jade Fox who is attempting to recruit the impressionable young Jen Yu to her cause. As the opposing forces of good and evil battle to secure the sword, they also struggle to lure Jen Lu to their side. Based on an early 20th century novel by Wang Du Lu, the project was scripted by Wang Hui Ling, James Schamus and Tsai Kuo Jung. Photographed by Peter Pau. Martial arts choreography by Yuen Wo-Ping. (Awards: Academy Awards 2001, Best Foreign Film, Best Music Score, Best Art Direction and Best Cinematography)
description_for_label: An epic love story and action drama, set in China during the Qing dynasty, revolving around two sets of lovers. (Awards: Academy Awards 2001, Best Foreign Film, Best Music Score, Best Art Direction and Best Cinematography)

results.title: The Omen
results.creator_credit: Richard Donner, Harvey Bernhard and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: In a moment of grief American Diplomat Robert Thorn (Gregory Peck) swaps his stillborn son with a newly born orphan, unbeknownst to his wife, Katherine (Lee Remick). What they both don’t know however is that the child was born at 6am, on the 6th day, of the 6th month (666), fulfilling a prophecy in the Bible that the coming of Armageddon will begin with the birth of Satan’s son. As their son, Damien (Harvey Stephens), grows older, it becomes apparent that this is no ordinary child. Sure enough, evil nannies, vicious dobermans and tormented priests begin to plague the family, while mysterious and gruesome deaths occur around the boy. This popular film spawned two sequels (“Damien: Omen 2” and “The Final conflict”). This 25th anniversary edition contains a documentary on the making of the film called “666: The Omen revealed”, a feature called “Curse or coincidence” about the mysterious incidents surrounding its production, interview clips and the original theatrical trailer. Cast also includes David Warner, Billie Whitelaw and Holly Palance.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Donner, Harvey Bernhard and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation

results.title: Where eagles dare
results.creator_credit: Brian G. Hutton, Elliott Kastner and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Richard Burton and Clint Eastwood star as Allied agents on a daring suicide mission in this tense wartime adventure. Held captive in an almost impregnable fortress in Bavaria, American General Carnaby is at the mercy of the German High Command. A group of agents attempt to liberate the General but as the mission progresses it becomes apparent that a double agent is attempting to foil this daring plot. Cast also includes Mary Ure, Micxhael Hordern, Patrick Wymark, Donald Houston. Based on the novel by Alistair MacLean.

results.title: The Right stuff
results.creator_credit: Philip Kaufman, Irwin Winkler, Robert Chartoff, The Ladd Company and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on Tom Wolfe’s best seller, “The Right Stuff” recounts the development of the American Space programme. Spanning 15 years, the film begins with Chuck Yeager breaking the sound barrier and moves on to concentrate primarily on the original seven Mercury astronauts. The film relates the perils and frustrations of the astronauts, their arduous training and complex personal lives, and the absurd lengths to which they must go to satisfy the public’s demand for real heroes. Cast includes Sam Shepard, Scott Glenn, Ed Harris, Dennis Quaid, Fred Ward and Barbara Hershey.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Philip Kaufman, Irwin Winkler, Robert Chartoff, The Ladd Company and Warner Bros Pictures

results.title: For whom the bell tolls
results.brief_description: A romantic drama set in 1937, during the Spanish Civil War. Gary Cooper plays Robert Jordan, an American who has joined a guerilla group and has been assigned to blow-up a Falangist controlled Bridge. He meets and falls in love with a young woman, played by Ingrid Bergman, who joined the group after her brutal treatment at the hands of the enemy. Written by Dudley Nichols, based on the novel by Ernest Hemingway, which was unanimously voted the best novel of the year in 1941 by the Pulitzer Prize committee, but was vetoed for political reasons. Cast also includes Akim Tamiroff, Arturo de Cordova and Katina Paxinou. Music by Victor Young. Photography by Ray Rennahan. Edited by Sherman Todd and John F. Link. (Awards: Katina Paxinou, Oscar 1943, Best Supporting Actress)

results.title: Celebrity
results.creator_credit: Woody Allen, Jean Doumanian, Magnolia Productions and Sweetland Films BV
results.brief_description: Kenneth Branagh is Lee Simon, a media obsessed journalist who is obsessed with celebrities and whose one aim in life is to bed as many famous media people as he can. This surprisingly light hearted satire by famous misanthrope, Woody Allen, sends up the lavish decadence of the famous and our perennial fascination with their sex lives and bad habits. Many Hollywood stars play themselves or versions of themselves, including a hilarious cameo by Leonardo Di Caprio as a self-obsessed drug addled superstar. Judy Davis plays Lee’s long suffering wife, who can’t compete with the famous starlets who come Lee’s way, and Branagh himself is excellent in a role which sees him spookily take on Woody Allen’s persona and quirks.

results.title: Fame
results.creator_credit: Allan Parker, Alan Marshall, David De Silva and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: An energetic musical drama tracing the lives of eight talented teenagers who join Manhattan’s High School for the Performing Arts to train for show business careers. Follows their creative journey and emotional development from their painstaking audition day to their euphoric graduation performance four years later. The film is noted for its award winning soundtrack and the spontaneous dance sequence in the streets of New York during peak hour traffic. Cast includes: Irene Cara, Lee Curreri, Laura Dean, Antonia Franceschi, Boyd Gaines, Albert Hague, Tresa Hughes, Steve Inwood, Paul McCrane, Anne Meara, Joanna Merlin, Barry Miller, Jim Moody, Gene Anthony Ray and Maureen Teefy. Written by Christopher Gore. Original music by Michael Gore. (Awards: Academy Award 1980, Best Original Score)

results.title: La Frontera
results.creator_credit: Ricardo Larrain, Dolores Soler, Mara Sanchex, Cine XXI, Filmocentro, ION Productions and Television Espanola
results.brief_description: In 1985, Santiago, Chile, a mathematics teacher, Ramiro Orellana (Patricio Contreras), is exiled to a remote local village after protesting against the abduction and disappearance of a colleague. At this faraway place, accessible only by water and once flooded by a tidal wave, Ramiro’s movements are kept in check by two local officials, whose interaction recalls the comic routines of Abbot and Costello. Though in exile, Ramiro gradually becomes acquainted with the local villagers and falls in love with a rather eccentric Spanish woman burdened with minding her mad father. Director Ricardo Larrain portrays the remote village as a mythic, natural, and innocent world, where our hero rekindles love and stumbles upon a past era buried beneath the water. In this way, Larrain affirms the richness of local cultures in opposition to the frenetic, superficial nature of the modern city. However, as a satellite of the central government, this place is also enmeshed in the absurdity of red tape and the cruel nature of politics itself, whereby the ruling regime can so easily incriminate an innocent and idealistic man. Drawing on the cinema of Bunuel and Tomas Gutierrez Alea, and with rich, plentiful characterisations and fluid storytelling, La Frontera is a fine example of contemporary Chilean cinema. In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: Gigi
results.creator_credit: Vincente Minnelli, Arthur Freed and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Gigi (Leslie Caron) is a young tomboy being transformed by her Aunts in the hope of her becoming a beautiful and successful courtesan - just like themselves in their hey day - to become the mistress of Gaston (Louis Jourdan). Inevitably, Gaston falls in love with Gigi, captivated by her innocence and child like manner. The protagonist of the film is provided by Maurice Chevalier as Gaston’s Uncle, who was once in love with Gigi’s aunt. Considered the last great film in Minelli’s career, the story is based on a story by Colette. Cast also includes Hermione Gingold, Eva Gabor and Isabel Jeans. (Awards: 13 Academy awards, including Best Picture, 1958)

results.title: Child's play
results.creator_credit: Tom Holland, David Kirschner and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: All Andy Barclay wants for his birthday is a Good Guy doll, regrettably his mother can’t afford one. Upset at being unable to deliver her son’s greatest wish, Karen goes to work only to discover a man selling Good Guy dolls in the alley behind the department store. She approaches the man, and for $30 the Good Guy doll is hers and she takes it home to Andy. However this is no ordinary doll. Following a police chase, serial killer Charles Lee Ray aka the Langshore Strangler, is shot and takes refuge in a doll factory. Before dying he uses voodoo to transfer his soul into a doll, the exact doll Karen buys for Andy. When Andy unwraps his new toy, ‘Chuckie’ continues to kill, his first victim, Andy’s Aunt Maggie. Andy tells the police ‘Chuckie did it’, but no one believes him and he is taken away to a psychiatric institution for children. When the murders continue, Karen discovers that Chuckie is battery-operated, and she forgot to insert his batteries. Detective Norris meets Chuckie and together they try to stop the doll’s killing spree. From an explosive start to an even more explosive ending, Child’s Play has become a cult film, spawning many sequels. Cast includes Catherine Hicks, Chris Sarandon, Alex Vincent and Brad Dourif as Chuckie.

Upset at being unable to deliver her son’s greatest wish, Karen goes to work only to discover a man selling Good Guy dolls in the alley behind the department store. She approaches the man, and for $30 the Good Guy doll is hers and she takes it home to Andy. However this is no ordinary doll. Following a police chase, serial killer Charles Lee Ray aka the Langshore Strangler, is shot and takes refuge in a doll factory. Before dying he uses voodoo to transfer his soul into a doll, the exact doll Karen buys for Andy. When Andy unwraps his new toy, ‘Chuckie’ continues to kill, his first victim, Andy’s Aunt Maggie. Andy tells the police ‘Chuckie did it’, but no one believes him and he is taken away to a psychiatric institution for children. When the murders continue, Karen discovers that Chuckie is battery-operated, and she forgot to insert his batteries. Detective Norris meets Chuckie and together they try to stop the doll’s killing spree. From an explosive start to an even more explosive ending, Child’s Play has become a cult film, spawning many sequels. Cast includes Catherine Hicks, Chris Sarandon, Alex Vincent and Brad Dourif as Chuckie.
